questions.question: Which method is the entry point of a Java program?
questions.explanation: Execution of a Java program begins from the main() method.

questions.question: Which keyword is used to declare a constant in Java?
questions.explanation: The final keyword prevents a variable from being modified.

questions.question: Which data type is used to store true or false values?
questions.explanation: boolean stores true/false values.

questions.question: Which symbol is used to end a Java statement?
questions.explanation: Each statement in Java ends with a semicolon.

questions.question: Which keyword is used to create an object?
questions.explanation: Objects are created using the new keyword.

questions.question: Which access modifier makes a member visible only within the same class?
questions.explanation: private restricts access to within the class.

questions.question: Which loop is guaranteed to execute at least once?
questions.explanation: do-while executes the body before checking the condition.

questions.question: Which keyword is used to inherit a class?
questions.explanation: extends allows one class to inherit another.

questions.question: Which collection does NOT allow duplicate values?
questions.explanation: Set enforces uniqueness of elements.

questions.question: Which package is automatically imported in every Java program?
questions.explanation: java.lang is imported by default.

questions.question: Which concept allows multiple methods with the same name but different parameters?
questions.explanation: Method overloading depends on parameter lists.

questions.question: Which keyword prevents a class from being inherited?
questions.explanation: final classes cannot be extended.

questions.question: Which interface is used to run code in a separate thread?
questions.explanation: Runnable is commonly implemented to create threads.

questions.question: What is the parent class of all Java classes?
questions.explanation: All classes extend Object directly or indirectly.

questions.question: Which exception is checked at compile time?
questions.explanation: Checked exceptions must be handled or declared.

questions.question: Which OOP principle hides internal details and exposes only necessary parts?
questions.explanation: Encapsulation bundles data and methods and restricts access.

questions.question: What is method overriding?
options: Same method name in same class
questions.explanation: Overriding provides a specific implementation in a subclass.

questions.question: Which keyword is used to call the parent class constructor?
questions.explanation: super() invokes the superclass constructor.

questions.question: Which type of polymorphism occurs at compile time?
questions.explanation: Compile-time polymorphism is achieved via overloading.

questions.question: Which keyword is used to prevent method overriding?
questions.explanation: final methods cannot be overridden.

questions.question: Which class allows dynamic resizing of arrays?
questions.explanation: ArrayList grows dynamically.

questions.question: Which Map implementation maintains insertion order?
questions.explanation: LinkedHashMap preserves insertion order.

questions.question: Which library is commonly used for building REST APIs in Java?
questions.explanation: Spring Boot simplifies REST service development.

questions.question: Which tool is used for unit testing in Java?
questions.explanation: JUnit is a popular testing framework.

questions.question: Which build tool uses pom.xml?
questions.explanation: Maven projects are configured using pom.xml.
